channel.title: Rendering on Aspose.Cells Product Family
channel.description: Recent content in Rendering on Aspose.Cells Product Family

item.title: Add PDF Bookmarks
item.description: This article provides information on how to insert PDF bookmarks when converting a spreadsheet to PDF. Aspose.Cells allows you to add bookmarks on the fly. PDF bookmarks can drastically improve the navigability of long documents. When adding bookmark links to PDF document, you can have precise control over the exact view you want, you’re not limited to linking to a page. You can set up the precise view by positioning the target page, and then create the bookmark.

item.title: Add PDF Bookmarks with Named Destinations
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Add PDF Bookmarks with Named Destinations 3 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios Named Destinations are special kinds of bookmarks or links in PDF that do not depend on PDF pages. It means, if pages are added or deleted from PDF, bookmarks may become invalid but named destinations will remain intact. To create Named Destination, please set the PdfBookmarkEntry.

item.title: Avoid Blank Page in Output PDF when there is Nothing to Print
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Avoid Blank Page in Output PDF when there is Nothing to Print 3 Sample Code 4 Exception | Possible Usage Scenarios When the Excel file is empty and the user saves it to PDF using Aspose.Cells, it renders a blank page in output PDF. Sometimes, this default behavior is undesirable. Aspose.Cells provides the PdfSaveOptions.

item.title: Control loading of External Resources in MS Excel Workbook while rendering to PDF
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Control loading of External Resources in MS Excel Workbook while rendering to PDF 3 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios Your Excel file may contain external resources e.g. linked images or objects. When you convert your Excel file to PDF, Aspose.Cells retrieves these external resources and renders them to PDF. But sometimes, you do not want to load these external resources and more than that, you want to manipulate them.

item.title: Create PdfBookmarkEntry for Chart Sheet
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Create PdfBookmarkEntry for Chart Sheet 3 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios Earlier, Aspose.Cells would create PdfBookmarkEntry for a normal sheet. But now Aspose.Cells can also create PdfBookmarkEntry for chart sheet. Since chart sheet does not have any other cell except cell A1, so it will create PdfBookmarkEntry for cell A1 only.

item.title: Export Range of Cells in a Worksheet to Image
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Export Range of Cells in a Worksheet to Image 3 Screenshot of Sample Excel File and its Exported Image 4 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios You can make an image of a worksheet using Aspose.Cells. However, sometimes you need to export only a range of cells in a worksheet to an image.

item.title: Get DrawObject and Bound while rendering to Pdf using DrawObjectEventHandler class
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Get DrawObject and Bound while rendering to Pdf using DrawObjectEventHandler class 3 Sample Code 4 Console Output | Possible Usage Scenarios Aspose.Cells provides an abstract class DrawObjectEventHandler which has a Draw() method. The user can implement DrawObjectEventHandler and utilize the Draw() method to get the DrawObject and Bound while rendering Excel to PDF or Image.

item.title: Ignore Errors while Rendering Excel to PDF
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Ignore Errors while Rendering Excel to PDF 3 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios Sometimes when you convert your Excel file to PDF, errors or exceptions occur and the conversion process terminates. You can ignore all such errors during the conversion process by using the PdfSaveOptions.IgnoreError property. This way, the conversion process will complete smoothly without throwing any error or exception but the loss of data may occur.

item.title: Output Blank Page when there is Nothing to Print
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Output Blank Page when there is Nothing to Print 3 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios If the sheet is empty, then Aspose.Cells will not print anything when you export worksheet to image. You can change this behavior by using ImageOrPrintOptions.OutputBlankPageWhenNothingToPrint property. When you will set it true, it will print the blank page.

item.title: Render Office Add-Ins while converting Excel to Pdf
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Render Office Add-Ins while converting Excel to Pdf 3 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios Earlier, Aspose.Cells could not render Office Add-Ins when Excel file is saved to Pdf format. Now Aspose.Cells renders it fine. You do not need to use any special method or property to render Office Add-Ins in output Pdf.

item.title: Render Sequence of Pages using PageIndex and PageCount Properties of ImageOrPrintOptions
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Render Sequence of Pages using PageIndex and PageCount Properties of ImageOrPrintOptions 3 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios You can render a sequence of pages of your Excel file to images by using Aspose.Cells with ImageOrPrintOptions.PageIndex and ImageOrPrintOptions.PageCount properties. These properties are useful when there are so many e.g. thousands of pages in your worksheet but you want to render some of them only.

item.title: Specify how to cross string in output PDF and image
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Specify how to cross string in output PDF/Image using TextCrossType | Possible Usage Scenarios When a cell contains text or string but it is larger than the width of the cell, then the string overflows if the next cell in the next column is null or empty. When you save your Excel file into PDF/Image, you can control this overflow by specifying the cross type using the TextCrossType enumeration.
